content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-197-03-B
|Item_parent=Spondyloarthritis
|Item_parent_short=Spondyloarthritis
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the role of genetic background: the HLA-B27 gene
|Description=Knowing the strong link with HLA B27 and its prevalence
|Rubric=Physiopathology
|Contributors=
|Order=3}}
The prevalence of HLA-B27 among patients with ankylosing spondylitis is over 90%, and 6 to 8% in Caucasian populations.

properties.question: What is the prevalence of HLA-B27 among patients with ankylosing spondylitis and in Caucasian populations?
properties.option_a: Over 90% in patients with ankylosing spondylitis and 2 to 3% in Caucasian populations
properties.option_b: Over 90% in patients with ankylosing spondylitis and 6 to 8% in Caucasian populations
properties.option_c: Under 50% in patients with ankylosing spondylitis and 10 to 12% in Caucasian populations
properties.option_d: 100% in patients with ankylosing spondylitis and less than 1% in Caucasian populations
